elements.name: ApplicantPanel
ApplicantName
elements.title: What is your name?

elements.name: ApplicantDOB
elements.title: What is your Date of Birth?

elements.name: helpNoHomeAddress
elements.title: What if I don't want to use my home address?
elements.body: You don't need to use your home address but you need to be able to served court documents. You can pick a daytime address such as your workplace or a lawyer's address if you have one.

elements.name: ApplicantAddress
elements.title: What is your mailing address?

elements.name: isLawyerAddress
elements.title: Is this a lawyer's address?
elements.description: You can use one if you pay your lawyer to send and receive mail for you.

elements.name: applicant.page.end
elements.title: Finished this page. You can add children and other adults later if you need to.

elements.name: respondentPanel
respondentName
elements.title:
What is the name of the person that {applicantName} (and/or their children) needs protection from? 

This is the person that will be the "respondent".

elements.name: RespondentIsExPartner
elements.title: Is {respondentName} a current or ex-partner of {applicantName}?

elements.name: RespondentIsChildsParent
elements.title: Is {respondentName} a parent or guardian of any of {applicantName}'s child?

elements.name: RespondentIsChildParentsRelative
elements.title: Is {respondentName} a relative of {applicantName}'s child's parent or guardian?

elements.name: RespondentIsExPartnersPartner
elements.title: Is {respondentName} a current partner of {applicantName}'s ex-partner?

elements.name: RespondentIsLiveInRelative
elements.title: Is {respondentName} a relative of {applicantName} who lives with {applicantName}?

elements.name: RespondentNotFamily
elements.title: {respondentName} needs to be a family member of {applicantName} (or their children). You can't just put in any random citizen. Try a peace bond maybe.

elements.name: RespondentDOB
elements.title: What is {respondentName}'s date of birth?
elements.description: You can still file for a Protection Order without this information. However, a Protection Order is most effective if this information is provided.

elements.name: RespondentDOBIDK
elements.title: I don't know the exact date

elements.name: question7
elements.title: What if I don't know what address to use?
elements.body: You don't need to use {respondent2.name's} home address but you need to be able to served court documents. You can pick a daytime address such as their workplace or somewhere you know {respondentName} will be staying.

elements.name: RespondentAddress
elements.title: What is {respondentName}'s mailing address?

elements.name: RespondentEmail
elements.title: Email (Optional)

elements.name: RespondentPhone
elements.title: Phone Number

elements.name: RespondentFax
elements.title: Fax Number (Optional)
Information about the Respondent

elements.name: Respondent2Needed
elements.title: Is there anyone else, other than {respondentName}, from whom {applicantName} (or their children) needs protection from?

elements.name: HaveChildren
elements.title: Does {applicantName} and/or {respondentName} have children?

elements.name: ChildPanel
ChildName
elements.title: Full name

elements.name: ChildNeedsProtection
elements.title: Does the Family Law Protection Order against {respondentName} need to include {childName}?

elements.name: helpChildNotNeedingProtection
elements.title: Even if {childName} does not need to be included in the Protection Order, the judge will still want to know about them.

elements.name: ChildDOB
elements.title: Date of Birth

elements.name: ChildDOBIDK
elements.title: If you don't know the {childName}'s exact date of birth, please choose one of the following:

choices.text: I know the child is younger than 19
I know the child is 19 or older

elements.name: ChildIsAdult
elements.title: {childName} is considered an adult. For the purposes of this service, we need to ask additional questions about their care, we need to know who they are living with etc..

elements.name: Guardianship
applicantChildRelationship
elements.title: Describe the relationship between {applicantName} (applicant), {respondentName} (respondent) and {childName}

choices.text: Does not spend time with child
Spends more than twice a week with child
Spends at least twice a week with Child
Spends at least once a week with Child
Spends at least every other week with child
Spends at least once a month with child
Spends at least once a year with child
Has contact without court ordered constraints
Has contact with child as agreed upon
Has contact with child under supervision/in presence of someone else

elements.name: helpGuardianship
elements.title: Guardianship is not the same as parenting.

elements.name: hasOtherGuardians
elements.title: Does {childName} have additional guardians other than the {applicantName} (Applicant) and {respondentName} (Respondent)?

elements.name: otherGuardians

choices.text: Does not spend time with child

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Does {respondentName} currently live with any of [names of pending protect parties]?
elements.description: we'll need lots of info here or expanding question topic about what it means to "currently live" with someone. in other words, ran away to a shelter/couch surfing vs moved out a month ago. FLA 184(4)

elements.name: question26
elements.title: Does anyone want to stay in the family home?

elements.name: question25
elements.title: Do you think you need the police to remove [respondent1] from where [applicants/children] live or are they leaving on their own?

choices.text: {respondentName} will probably leave on their own

elements.name: question28
elements.title: Does [names of pending protected parties] have any {respondentName}'s personal belongings?
elements.description: Leave out the stolen items. make the help text more about clothing and daily-needed items. the whole point is to avoid having to come back and forth to grab stuff each time.

elements.name: question43
elements.title: Do you think you need the police to accompany you to remove personal belongings from where {respondentName} lives?

question51

elements.title: Address
What is the address of the family home?

elements.name: question44
elements.title: Would {respondentName} need to contact you for ongoing court thing?
elements.description: Even with a No Contact order, there may be times where it is important to contact each for certain purposes.

elements.name: question52
elements.title: Is there any third parties that {respondentName} and {applicant} you can communicate through?

elements.name: question53
elements.title: Tell us who

elements.name: question54
elements.title: Does {respondentName} need to contact {appliant.name} to arrange parentingtime/childcare/etc

elements.name: question55
elements.title: methods?

elements.name: question56
elements.title: Any other reason that {respondentName} would need to contact {applicant}?

elements.name: question57
elements.title: What reason(s)?

elements.name: question58
elements.title: Are there any places where [respondent] needs to stay away from?

elements.name: question59
elements.title: Are you afraid [Respondent] will harm you or family members with weapons (including guns, explosives)?

elements.name: question60
elements.title: By selecting no above, you are saying there is no need for a judge to order [respondent] to give up their weapons if they have any. They also won't be able to possess any weapons for the duraction of this protection order. If there is no concern over weapons, hit "there is no concern over weapons" Otherwise, consider going back to the last question and selecting 'yes' instead.

elements.name: question61
elements.title: Do you think [Respondent1] have guns, explosives or something?

elements.name: question62
elements.title: Does you think [Respondent1] have weapons that are not guns, explosives?

elements.name: question63
elements.title: This is a review of everything. Show the box and show summary. Edit button to go back to topic page.

elements.name: question64
elements.title: Protection Orders usually last 1 year from the date the judge makes the order. Do you wish to make the order last a different amount of time?

elements.name: question65
elements.title: What date do you think the POR should expire?
elements.description: You will need to explain to the judge why you think this new date matters.

elements.name: question66
elements.title: Do you need [Respondent1] to carry a copy of this order (if it is granted) on their person at all times for the duration of order.

elements.name: question67
elements.title: Tell someone they finish the form. This is what it looks like. Here's next steps. By the way, urgency questions

elements.name: question68
elements.title: Do you feel you need this protection order sooner?

elements.name: question69
elements.title: How soon do you need this protection order?
